required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Pharmacist-Administered Injections of Depo-Medroxyprogesterone Acetate for Contraception: A Pilot Randomized Controlled Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

clinical_study.source: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to see if it is a feasible arrangement to have women receive their second and third birth control injection (with Depo-Provera) at a pharmacy compared with receiving it a Planned Parenthood Clinic. Compliance with returning for injections as well as patient satisfaction with the method, providers, and location where injection was received will be assessed and compared between the two sites. The hypothesis is that there will be no difference in return rates for injections at either the pharmacy or the clinic site.

detailed_description.textblock: Women who want to use or are currently using Depo-Provera for contraception will be randomized to receive their next two injections either back at the Planned Parenthood clinic or at a local pharmacy where pharmacists are trained to give injections. After each injection, women will be asked to complete a questionnaire to assess their attitudes about the method of birth control, their providers, and the location where they received the injection.

primary_outcome.measure: Compliance in returning for 3 month and 6 month injections
primary_outcome.time_frame: 3 months and 6 months after first injection

arm_group.description: Women receive their second and third depot-medroxyprogesterone acetate injections at the pharmacy by clinical pharmacists
Women receive their second and third depot-medroxyprogesterone acetate injections per usual care at their Planned Parenthood clinic.

intervention.description: women will receive their injections at a pharmacy by a clinical pharmacist
women will return for their injections to the clinic where recruitment took place. They will receive one at 3 months and 6 months.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- At least 18 y.o., English speaking/reading, presenting to Planned Parenthood to use Depo Provera (restarting, first use, or continuing use)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Under 18 years of age, English illiterate (reading and verbal)

overall_official.affiliation: Dept. of Social Medicine, University of North Carolina

facility.name: Planned Parenthood of Central North Carolina

responsible_party.organization: University of North Carolina, Dept. of Social Medicine

clinical_study.keyword: Compliance in receiving additional Depo Provera injections
Satisfaction in receiving Depo Provera injections at a pharmacy compared with usual clinic
